PropGravitasDeskPodium.desc:
A clutter-proof desk to minimize distractions.

There appears to be something stored in the computer.

PropGravitasCreaturePoster.name: Anatomy Poster
PropGravitasCreaturePoster.desc:
An anatomical illustration of the very first Hatch ever produced.

While the ratio of egg sac to brain may appear outlandish, it is in fact to scale.

PropGravitasCeilingRobot.name: Ceiling Robot
PropGravitasCeilingRobot.desc: Non-functioning robotic arms that once assisted lab technicians.

PropFacilityWallDegree.name: Doctorate Degree
PropFacilityWallDegree.desc: Certification in Applied Physics, awarded in recognition of one "Jacquelyn A. Stern".

PropFacilityTable.name: Coffee Table
PropFacilityTable.desc: A low coffee table that may have once held old science magazines.

PropFacilityStatue.name: Gravitas Monument
PropFacilityStatue.desc:
A large, modern sculpture that sits in the center of the lobby.

It's an artistic cross between an hourglass shape and a double helix.

PropFacilityPainting.name: Landscape Portrait
PropFacilityPainting.desc:
A painting featuring a copse of fir trees and a magnificent mountain range on the horizon.

The air in the room prickles with the sensation that I'm not meant to be here.

PropFacilityHangingLight.name: Light Fixture
PropFacilityHangingLight.desc:
A long light fixture that hangs from the ceiling.

It does not appear to function.

PropGravitasDecorativeWindow.name: Window
PropGravitasDecorativeWindow.desc: A tall, thin window which once pointed to a courtyard.

PropFacilityGlobeDroors.name: Filing Cabinet
PropFacilityGlobeDroors.desc:
A filing cabinet for storing hard copy employee records.

The contents have been shredded.

PropGravitasShelf.name: Shelf
PropGravitasShelf.desc: A shelf holding jars just out of reach for a short person.

PropReceptionDesk.name: Reception Desk
PropReceptionDesk.desc:
A full coffee cup and a note abandoned mid sentence sit behind the desk.

It gives me an eerie feeling, as if the receptionist has stepped out and will return any moment.

WarpReceiver.name: Teleporter Receiver
WarpReceiver.desc:
The functional remnants of an intricate teleportation system.

This is the incoming side.

WarpPortal.name: Teleporter Transmitter
WarpPortal.desc:
The functional remnants of an intricate teleportation system.

This is the outgoing side, and has one pre-programmed destination.

StickerBomb.name: Sticker Bomb
StickerBomb.desc: Surprise decor sneak attacks a Duplicant's gloomy day.

SetLocker.name: Locker
SetLocker.desc:
A basic metal locker.

It contains an assortment of personal effects.

PropGravitasSmallSeedLocker.name: Wall Cabinet
PropGravitasSmallSeedLocker.desc:
A small glass cabinet.

There's a biohazard symbol on it.

CryoTank.name: Cryotank 3000
CryoTank.desc:
The tank appears impossibly old, but smells crisp and brand new.

A silhouette just barely visible through the frost of the glass.

PropLight.name: Light Fixture
PropLight.desc: An elegant ceiling lamp, slightly worse for wear.

ScoutLander.name: Rover's Lander
ScoutLander.desc: Lands Rover on a Planetoid when Rover's Module is in orbit.

RailGunPayload.name: Interplanetary Payload
RailGunPayload.desc:
Contains resources packed for interstellar shipping.

Can be launched by a Interplanetary Launcher or unpacked with a Payload Opener.

PropTallPlant.name: Office Plant
PropTallPlant.desc: It's survived the vacuum of space by virtue of being plastic.

PropSurfaceSatellite3.name: Crushed Satellite
PropSurfaceSatellite3.desc: All that remains of a once peacefully orbiting satellite.

PropSurfaceSatellite2.name: Wrecked Satellite
PropSurfaceSatellite2.desc: All that remains of a once peacefully orbiting satellite.

PropSurfaceSatellite1.name: Crashed Satellite
PropSurfaceSatellite1.desc: All that remains of a once peacefully orbiting satellite.

PropSkeleton.name: Model Skeleton
PropSkeleton.desc:
A detailed anatomical model.

It appears to be made of resin.

SweepBot.name: Sweepy
SweepBot.desc:
An automated sweeping robot.

Sweeps up Solid debris and Liquid spills and stores the material back in its Sweepy Dock.

CompostSalsa.name: Stuffed Berry
CompostSalsa.desc: A baked Bristle Berry stuffed with delectable spices and vibrantly flavored.

Salsa.name: Stuffed Berry
Salsa.desc: A baked Bristle Berry stuffed with delectable spices and vibrantly flavored.

PropFacilityDisplay.name: Electronic Display
PropFacilityDisplay.desc:
An electronic display projecting the blueprint of a familiar device.

It looks like a Printing Pod.

PropFacilityDisplay2.name: Electronic Display
PropFacilityDisplay2.desc:
An electronic display projecting the blueprint of a familiar device.

It looks like a Mining Gun.

MissileBasic.name: Blastshot
MissileBasic.desc:
An explosive projectile designed to defend against meteor showers.

Must be launched by a Meteor Blaster.

keepsake_megabrain.name: Model Plane
keepsake_megabrain.desc: A treasured souvenir that was once a common accompaniment to children's meals during commercial flights. There's a hole in the bottom from when Dr. Holland had it mounted on a stand.

keepsake_crittermanipulator.name: Ceramic Morb
keepsake_crittermanipulator.desc:
A pottery project produced in an HR-mandated art therapy class.

It's glazed with a substance that once landed a curious lab technician in the ER.

keepsake_lonelyminion.name: Rusty Toolbox
keepsake_lonelyminion.desc: On the inside of the lid, someone used a screwdriver to carve a drawing of a group of smiling Duplicants gathered around a massive crater.

keepsake_fossilhunt.name: Critter Collar
keepsake_fossilhunt.desc:
The tag reads "Molly".

On the reverse is "Designed by B363" stamped above what appears to be an unusually shaped pawprint.

keepsake_morbrovermaker.name: Toy Bot
keepsake_morbrovermaker.desc:
A custom-made robot programmed to deliver puns in a variety of celebrity voices.

It is also a paper shredder.

GeneShufflerRecharge.name: Vacillator Recharge
GeneShufflerRecharge.desc: Replenishes one charge to a depleted Neural Vacillator.

PropFacilityDisplay3.name: Electronic Display
PropFacilityDisplay3.desc:
An electronic display projecting the blueprint of a strange device.

Perhaps these displays were used to entice visitors.

PropFacilityDesk.name: Director's Desk
PropFacilityDesk.desc:
A spotless desk filled with impeccably organized office supplies.

A photo peeks out from beneath the desk pad, depicting two beaming young women in caps and gowns.

The photo is quite old.

PropFacilityCouch.name: Lobby Couch
PropFacilityCouch.desc: A couch where visitors can comfortably wait before their appointments.

PropFacilityChandelier.name: Chandelier
PropFacilityChandelier.desc:
A large chandelier that hangs from the ceiling.

It does not appear to function.

PropFacilityChairFlip.name: Lobby Chair
PropFacilityChairFlip.desc: A chair where visitors can comfortably wait before their appointments.

PropFacilityChair.name: Lobby Chair
PropFacilityChair.desc: A chair where visitors can comfortably wait before their appointments.

PropElevator.name: Broken Elevator
PropElevator.desc:
Out of service.

The buttons inside indicate it went down more than a dozen floors at one point in time.

PropDesk.name: Computer Desk
PropDesk.desc: An intact office desk, decorated with several personal belongings and a barely functioning computer.

PropClock.name: Clock
PropClock.desc:
A simple wall clock.

It is no longer ticking.

PioneerLander.name: Trailblazer Lander
PioneerLander.desc: Lands a Duplicant on a Planetoid from an orbiting Trailblazer Module.

RotPile.name: Rot Pile
RotPile.desc:
An inedible glop of former foodstuff.

Rot Piles break down into Polluted Dirt over time.

CompostRawEgg.name: Raw Egg
CompostRawEgg.desc:
A raw Egg that has been cracked open for use in Food preparation.

It will never hatch.

RawEgg.name: Raw Egg
RawEgg.desc:
A raw Egg that has been cracked open for use in Food preparation.

It will never hatch.

DehydratedQuiche.name: Dried Mushroom Quiche
DehydratedQuiche.desc:
A dehydrated Mushroom Quiche ration. It must be rehydrated in order to be considered Food.

Dry rations have no expiry date.

SquirrelEgg.name: Pip Egg
SquirrelEgg.desc:
Pips are pesky, nonhostile critters that subsist on Thimble Reeds and Arbor Tree branches.

They are known to bury Seeds in the ground whenever they can find a suitable area with enough space.

Squirrel.name: Pip
Squirrel.desc:
Pips are pesky, nonhostile critters that subsist on Thimble Reeds and Arbor Tree branches.

They are known to bury Seeds in the ground whenever they can find a suitable area with enough space.

SquirrelHugEgg.name: Cuddle Pip Egg
SquirrelHugEgg.desc:
Cuddle Pips are fluffy, affectionate critters who exhibit a strong snuggling instinct towards all types of eggs.

This is temporarily amplified when they are hugged by a passing Duplicant.

SquirrelHug.name: Cuddle Pip
SquirrelHug.desc:
Cuddle Pips are fluffy, affectionate critters who exhibit a strong snuggling instinct towards all types of eggs.

This is temporarily amplified when they are hugged by a passing Duplicant.

StaterpillarEgg.name: Slug Egg
StaterpillarEgg.desc:
Plug Slugs are dynamic creatures that generate electrical Power during the night.

Their power can be harnessed by leaving an exposed wire near areas where they like to sleep.

Staterpillar.name: Plug Slug
Staterpillar.desc:
Plug Slugs are dynamic creatures that generate electrical Power during the night.

Their power can be harnessed by leaving an exposed wire near areas where they like to sleep.

HighEnergyParticle.name: Radbolts
HighEnergyParticle.desc: A concentrated field of Radbolts that can be largely redirected using a Radbolt Reflector.

StaterpillarLiquidEgg.name: Sponge Slug Egg
StaterpillarLiquidEgg.desc:
Sponge Slugs are thirsty creatures that soak up Liquids during the day.

They deposit their stored Liquids into the exposed Liquid Pipes they sleep next to at night.

StaterpillarLiquid.name: Sponge Slug
StaterpillarLiquid.desc:
Sponge Slugs are thirsty creatures that soak up Liquids during the day.

They deposit their stored Liquids into the exposed Liquid Pipes they sleep next to at night.

BasicFabric.name: Reed Fiber
BasicFabric.desc: A ball of raw cellulose used in the production of Clothing and textiles.

CompostBasicFabricMaterialPlantSeed.name: Thimble Reed Seed
CompostBasicFabricMaterialPlantSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Thimble Reed.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Thimble Reed Seed.

BasicFabricMaterialPlantSeed.name: Thimble Reed Seed
BasicFabricMaterialPlantSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Thimble Reed.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Thimble Reed Seed.

BasicFabricPlant.name: Thimble Reed
BasicFabricPlant.desc: Thimble Reeds produce indescribably soft Reed Fiber for Clothing production.

BasicForagePlant.name: Muckroot
BasicForagePlant.desc:
A seedless fruit with an upsettingly bland aftertaste.

It cannot be replanted.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Muckroot.

BasicForagePlantPlanted.name: Buried Muckroot
BasicForagePlantPlanted.desc: Muckroots are incapable of propagating but can be harvested for a single Food serving.

CompostBasicSingleHarvestPlantSeed.name: Mealwood Seed
CompostBasicSingleHarvestPlantSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Mealwood.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Mealwood Seed.

BasicSingleHarvestPlantSeed.name: Mealwood Seed
BasicSingleHarvestPlantSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Mealwood.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Mealwood Seed.

BasicSingleHarvestPlant.name: Mealwood
BasicSingleHarvestPlant.desc: Mealwoods produce Meal Lice, an oddly wriggly grain that can be harvested for Food.

CompostBeanPlantSeed.name: Nosh Bean
CompostBeanPlantSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Nosh Sprout.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Nosh Bean.

BeanPlantSeed.name: Nosh Bean
BeanPlantSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Nosh Sprout.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Nosh Bean.

BeanPlant.name: Nosh Sprout
BeanPlant.desc: Nosh Sprouts thrive in colder climates and produce edible Nosh Beans.

CompostCactusPlantSeed.name: Joya Seed
CompostCactusPlantSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Jumping Joya.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Joya Seed.

CactusPlantSeed.name: Joya Seed
CactusPlantSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Jumping Joya.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Joya Seed.

CactusPlant.name: Jumping Joya
CactusPlant.desc: Joyas are Decorative Plants that are colloquially said to make gardeners "jump for joy".

CompostColdBreatherSeed.name: Wort Seed
CompostColdBreatherSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Wheezewort.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Wort Seed.

ColdBreatherSeed.name: Wort Seed
ColdBreatherSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Wheezewort.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Wort Seed.

ColdBreather.name: Wheezewort
ColdBreather.desc: Wheezeworts can be planted in Planter Boxes, Farm Tiles or Hydroponic Farms, and absorb Heat by respiring through their porous outer membranes.

CompostColdWheatSeed.name: Sleet Wheat Grain
CompostColdWheatSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Sleet Wheat plant.

Grain can be sown to cultivate more Sleet Wheat, or processed into Food.

ColdWheatSeed.name: Sleet Wheat Grain
ColdWheatSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Sleet Wheat plant.

Grain can be sown to cultivate more Sleet Wheat, or processed into Food.

ColdWheat.name: Sleet Wheat
ColdWheat.desc: Sleet Wheat produces Sleet Wheat Grain, a chilly grain that can be processed into Food.

CompostCritterTrapPlantSeed.name: Saturn Critter Trap Seed
CompostCritterTrapPlantSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Saturn Critter Trap.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Saturn Critter Trap Seed.

CritterTrapPlantSeed.name: Saturn Critter Trap Seed
CritterTrapPlantSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Saturn Critter Trap.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Saturn Critter Trap Seed.

CritterTrapPlant.name: Saturn Critter Trap
CritterTrapPlant.desc: Critter Traps are carnivorous plants that trap unsuspecting critters and consume them, releasing Hydrogen Gas as waste.

CompostCylindricaSeed.name: Bliss Burst Seed
CompostCylindricaSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Bliss Burst.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Bliss Burst Seed.

CylindricaSeed.name: Bliss Burst Seed
CylindricaSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Bliss Burst.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Bliss Burst Seed.

Cylindrica.name: Bliss Burst
Cylindrica.desc: Bliss Bursts release an explosion of Decor into otherwise dull environments.

CompostEvilFlowerSeed.name: Sporechid Seed
CompostEvilFlowerSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Sporechid.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Sporechid Seed.

EvilFlowerSeed.name: Sporechid Seed
EvilFlowerSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Sporechid.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Sporechid Seed.

EvilFlower.name: Sporechid
EvilFlower.desc: Sporechids have an eerily alluring appearance to mask the fact that they host particularly nasty strain of brain fungus.

CompostFilterPlantSeed.name: Hydrocactus Seed
CompostFilterPlantSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Hydrocactus.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Hydrocactus Seed.

FilterPlantSeed.name: Hydrocactus Seed
FilterPlantSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Hydrocactus.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Hydrocactus Seed.

ForestForagePlant.name: Hexalent Fruit
ForestForagePlant.desc:
A seedless fruit with an unusual rubbery texture.

It cannot be replanted.

Hexalent fruit is much more calorie dense than Muckroot fruit.

ForestForagePlantPlanted.name: Hexalent
ForestForagePlantPlanted.desc: Hexalents are incapable of propagating but can be harvested for a single, calorie dense Food serving.

ForestTreeBranch.name: Arbor Tree
ForestTreeBranch.desc: Arbor Trees grow Arbor Tree Branches and can be harvested for lumber.

CompostBulbPlantSeed.name: Buddy Bud Seed
CompostBulbPlantSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Buddy Bud.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Buddy Bud Seed.

BulbPlantSeed.name: Buddy Bud Seed
BulbPlantSeed.desc:
The Seed of a Buddy Bud.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Buddy Bud Seed.

BulbPlant.name: Buddy Bud
BulbPlant.desc: Buddy Buds are leafy plants that have a positive effect on Morale, much like a friend.

CompostForestTreeSeed.name: Arbor Acorn
CompostForestTreeSeed.desc:
The Seed of an Arbor Tree.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover an Arbor Acorn.

ForestTreeSeed.name: Arbor Acorn
ForestTreeSeed.desc:
The Seed of an Arbor Tree.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover an Arbor Acorn.

ForestTree.name: Arbor Tree
ForestTree.desc: Arbor Trees grow Arbor Tree Branches and can be harvested for lumber.

ScoutRover.name: Rover
ScoutRover.desc: A curious bot that can remotely explore new Planetoid locations.

PuftEgg.name: Puftlet Egg
PuftEgg.desc: Pufts are non-aggressive critters that excrete lumps of Slime with each breath.

Puft.name: Puft
Puft.desc: Pufts are non-aggressive critters that excrete lumps of Slime with each breath.

DebrisPayload.name: Rocket Debris
DebrisPayload.desc: Whatever is left over from a Rocket Self-Destruct can be recovered once it has crash-landed.

EscapePod.name: Escape Pod
EscapePod.desc: Delivers a Duplicant from a stranded rocket to the nearest Planetoid.

BeeHive.name: Beeta Hive
BeeHive.desc:
A moderately Radioactive nest made by Beetas.

Converts Uranium Ore into Enriched Uranium when worked by a Beeta.
Will not function if ground below has been destroyed.

Bee.name: Beeta
Bee.desc:
Beetas are hostile critters that thrive in Radioactive environments.

They commonly gather Uranium Ore for their Beeta Hives to produce Enriched Uranium.

DreckoEgg.name: Drecklet Egg
DreckoEgg.desc:
Dreckos are nonhostile critters that graze on Pincha Pepperplants, Balm Lily or Mealwood Plants.

Their backsides are covered in thick woolly fibers that only grow in Hydrogen climates.

Drecko.name: Drecko
Drecko.desc:
Dreckos are nonhostile critters that graze on Pincha Pepperplants, Balm Lily or Mealwood Plants.

Their backsides are covered in thick woolly fibers that only grow in Hydrogen climates.

DreckoPlasticEgg.name: Glossy Drecklet Egg
DreckoPlasticEgg.desc:
Glossy Dreckos are nonhostile critters that graze on live Mealwood Plants and Bristle Blossoms.

Their backsides are covered in bioplastic scales that only grow in Hydrogen Gas climates.

DreckoPlastic.name: Glossy Drecko
DreckoPlastic.desc:
Glossy Dreckos are nonhostile critters that graze on live Mealwood Plants and Bristle Blossoms.

Their backsides are covered in bioplastic scales that only grow in Hydrogen Gas climates.

Glom.name: Morb
Glom.desc: Morbs are attracted to unhygienic conditions and frequently excrete bursts of Polluted Oxygen.

LightBugBlackEgg.name: Abyss Nymph Egg
LightBugBlackEgg.desc: This Shine Bug emits no Light, but it makes up for it by having an excellent personality.

LightBugBlack.name: Abyss Bug
LightBugBlack.desc: This Shine Bug emits no Light, but it makes up for it by having an excellent personality.

LightBugBlueEgg.name: Azure Nymph Egg
LightBugBlueEgg.desc:
Shine Bugs emit a soft Light in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.

The light of the Azure morph has been turned blue through selective breeding.

LightBugBlue.name: Azure Bug
LightBugBlue.desc:
Shine Bugs emit a soft Light in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.

The light of the Azure morph has been turned blue through selective breeding.

LightBugEgg.name: Shine Nymph Egg
LightBugEgg.desc: Shine Bugs emit a soft Light in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.

LightBug.name: Shine Bug
LightBug.desc: Shine Bugs emit a soft Light in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.

PuftOxyliteEgg.name: Dense Puftlet Egg
PuftOxyliteEgg.desc: Dense Pufts are non-aggressive critters that excrete condensed Oxylite with each breath.

PuftOxylite.name: Dense Puft
PuftOxylite.desc: Dense Pufts are non-aggressive critters that excrete condensed Oxylite with each breath.

LightBugCrystalEgg.name: Radiant Nymph Egg
LightBugCrystalEgg.desc:
Shine Bugs emit a soft Light in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.

The light of the Radiant morph has been amplified through selective breeding.

LightBugCrystal.name: Radiant Bug
LightBugCrystal.desc:
Shine Bugs emit a soft Light in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.

The light of the Radiant morph has been amplified through selective breeding.

LightBugPinkEgg.name: Coral Nymph Egg
LightBugPinkEgg.desc:
Shine Bugs emit a soft Light in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.

The light of the Coral morph has been turned pink through selective breeding.

LightBugPink.name: Coral Bug
LightBugPink.desc:
Shine Bugs emit a soft Light in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.

The light of the Coral morph has been turned pink through selective breeding.

LightBugPurpleEgg.name: Royal Nymph Egg
LightBugPurpleEgg.desc:
Shine Bugs emit a soft Light in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.

The light of the Royal morph has been turned purple through selective breeding.

LightBugPurple.name: Royal Bug
LightBugPurple.desc:
Shine Bugs emit a soft Light in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.

The light of the Royal morph has been turned purple through selective breeding.

MoleEgg.name: Shove Vole Egg
MoleEgg.desc:
Shove Voles are burrowing critters that eat the Regolith collected on terrestrial surfaces.

They cannot burrow through Refined Metals.

Mole.name: Shove Vole
Mole.desc:
Shove Voles are burrowing critters that eat the Regolith collected on terrestrial surfaces.

They cannot burrow through Refined Metals.

MoleDelicacyEgg.name: Delecta Vole Egg
MoleDelicacyEgg.desc:
Delecta Voles are burrowing critters whose bodies sprout shearable Tonic Root when Regolith is ingested at preferred temperatures.

They cannot burrow through Refined Metals.

MoleDelicacy.name: Delecta Vole
MoleDelicacy.desc:
Delecta Voles are burrowing critters whose bodies sprout shearable Tonic Root when Regolith is ingested at preferred temperatures.

They cannot burrow through Refined Metals.

Moo.name: Gassy Moo
Moo.desc:
Moos are extraterrestrial critters that feed on Gas Grass and excrete Natural Gas.

When domesticated and fed, they can be milked for Brackene.

MorbRover.name: Biobot
MorbRover.desc:
A Pathogen-Fueled Extravehicular Geo-Exploratory Guidebot (model Y), aka "P.E.G.G.Y."

It can be assigned basic building tasks and digging duties in hazardous environments.

OilfloaterEgg.name: Larva Egg
OilfloaterEgg.desc: Slicksters are slimy critters that consume Carbon Dioxide and exude Crude Oil.

Oilfloater.name: Slickster
Oilfloater.desc: Slicksters are slimy critters that consume Carbon Dioxide and exude Crude Oil.

OilfloaterDecorEgg.name: Longhair Larva Egg
OilfloaterDecorEgg.desc:
Longhair Slicksters are friendly critters that consume Oxygen and thrive in close contact with Duplicant companions.

Longhairs have extremely beautiful and luxurious coats.

OilfloaterDecor.name: Longhair Slickster
OilfloaterDecor.desc:
Longhair Slicksters are friendly critters that consume Oxygen and thrive in close contact with Duplicant companions.

Longhairs have extremely beautiful and luxurious coats.

OilfloaterHighTempEgg.name: Molten Larva Egg
OilfloaterHighTempEgg.desc: Molten Slicksters are slimy critters that consume Carbon Dioxide and exude Petroleum.

OilfloaterHighTemp.name: Molten Slickster
OilfloaterHighTemp.desc: Molten Slicksters are slimy critters that consume Carbon Dioxide and exude Petroleum.

PuftAlphaEgg.name: Puftlet Prince Egg
PuftAlphaEgg.desc: The Puft Prince is a lazy critter that excretes little Solid lumps of whatever it has been breathing.

PuftAlpha.name: Puft Prince
PuftAlpha.desc: The Puft Prince is a lazy critter that excretes little Solid lumps of whatever it has been breathing.

PuftBleachstoneEgg.name: Squeaky Puftlet Egg
PuftBleachstoneEgg.desc: Squeaky Pufts are non-aggressive critters that excrete lumps of Bleachstone with each breath.

PuftBleachstone.name: Squeaky Puft
PuftBleachstone.desc: Squeaky Pufts are non-aggressive critters that excrete lumps of Bleachstone with each breath.

LightBugOrangeEgg.name: Sun Nymph Egg
LightBugOrangeEgg.desc:
Shine Bugs emit a soft Light in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.

The light of the Sun morph has been turned orange through selective breeding.

LightBugOrange.name: Sun Bug
LightBugOrange.desc:
Shine Bugs emit a soft Light in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.

The light of the Sun morph has been turned orange through selective breeding.

CompostGasGrassSeed.name: Gas Grass Seed
CompostGasGrassSeed.desc: The Seed of a Gas Grass plant.

GasGrassSeed.name: Gas Grass Seed
GasGrassSeed.desc: The Seed of a Gas Grass plant.

GasGrass.name: Gas Grass
GasGrass.desc: Gas Grass is an alien lifeform tentatively categorized as a "plant," which makes up the entirety of the Gassy Moo's diet.

StaterpillarGasEgg.name: Smog Slug Egg
StaterpillarGasEgg.desc:
Smog Slugs are porous creatures that draw in unbreathable Gases during the day.

At night, they sleep near exposed Gas Pipes, where they deposit their cache.

StaterpillarGas.name: Smog Slug
StaterpillarGas.desc:
Smog Slugs are porous creatures that draw in unbreathable Gases during the day.

At night, they sleep near exposed Gas Pipes, where they deposit their cache.

GeyserGeneric_steam.name: Cool Steam Vent
GeyserGeneric_steam.desc: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with Steam.

GeyserGeneric_hot_steam.name: Steam Vent
GeyserGeneric_hot_steam.desc: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with scalding Steam.

GeyserGeneric_hot_water.name: Water Geyser
GeyserGeneric_hot_water.desc: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with hot Water.

GeyserGeneric_slush_water.name: Cool Slush Geyser
GeyserGeneric_slush_water.desc: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with freezing Polluted Water.

GeyserGeneric_filthy_water.name: Polluted Water Vent
GeyserGeneric_filthy_water.desc: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with boiling Contaminated Water.

GeyserGeneric_slush_salt_water.name: Cool Salt Slush Geyser
GeyserGeneric_slush_salt_water.desc: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with freezing Brine.

GeyserGeneric_salt_water.name: Salt Water Geyser
GeyserGeneric_salt_water.desc: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with Salt Water.

GeyserGeneric_small_volcano.name: Minor Volcano
GeyserGeneric_small_volcano.desc: A miniature volcano that periodically erupts with molten Magma.

GeyserGeneric_big_volcano.name: Volcano
GeyserGeneric_big_volcano.desc: A massive volcano that periodically erupts with molten Magma.

GeyserGeneric_liquid_co2.name: Carbon Dioxide Geyser
GeyserGeneric_liquid_co2.desc: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with boiling Liquid Carbon Dioxide.

GeyserGeneric_hot_co2.name: Carbon Dioxide Vent
GeyserGeneric_hot_co2.desc: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with hot Carbon Dioxide.

GeyserGeneric_hot_hydrogen.name: Hydrogen Vent
GeyserGeneric_hot_hydrogen.desc: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with hot gaseous Hydrogen.

GeyserGeneric_hot_po2.name: Hot Polluted Oxygen Vent
GeyserGeneric_hot_po2.desc: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with hot Polluted Oxygen.

GeyserGeneric_slimy_po2.name: Infectious Polluted Oxygen Vent
GeyserGeneric_slimy_po2.desc: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with warm Polluted Oxygen.

GeyserGeneric_chlorine_gas.name: Chlorine Gas Vent
GeyserGeneric_chlorine_gas.desc: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with warm Chlorine Gas.

GeyserGeneric_methane.name: Natural Gas Geyser
GeyserGeneric_methane.desc: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with hot Natural Gas.

GeyserGeneric_molten_copper.name: Copper Volcano
GeyserGeneric_molten_copper.desc: A large volcano that periodically erupts with Molten Copper.

GeyserGeneric_molten_iron.name: Iron Volcano
GeyserGeneric_molten_iron.desc: A large volcano that periodically erupts with Molten Iron.

GeyserGeneric_molten_gold.name: Gold Volcano
GeyserGeneric_molten_gold.desc: A large volcano that periodically erupts with Molten Gold.

GeyserGeneric_molten_aluminum.name: Aluminum Volcano
GeyserGeneric_molten_aluminum.desc: A large volcano that periodically erupts with Molten Aluminum.

GeyserGeneric_molten_tungsten.name: Tungsten Volcano
GeyserGeneric_molten_tungsten.desc: A large volcano that periodically erupts with Molten Tungsten.

GeyserGeneric_molten_niobium.name: Niobium Volcano
GeyserGeneric_molten_niobium.desc: A large volcano that periodically erupts with Niobium.

GeyserGeneric_molten_cobalt.name: Cobalt Volcano
GeyserGeneric_molten_cobalt.desc: A large volcano that periodically erupts with Molten Cobalt.

GeyserGeneric_oil_drip.name: Leaky Oil Fissure

A tender little Delecta Vole pup.

One day it will grow into an adult Shove Vole morph, the Delecta Vole.

MoleBaby.name: Vole Pup
MoleBaby.desc:
Shove Voles are burrowing critters that eat the Regolith collected on terrestrial surfaces.

They cannot burrow through Refined Metals.

HatchVeggieBaby.name: Sage Hatchling
HatchVeggieBaby.desc:
A doofy little Sage Hatchling.

It matures into an adult Hatch morph, the Sage Hatch, which loves nibbling on organic materials.

Atmo_Suit.name: Atmo Suit
Atmo_Suit.desc: Supplies Duplicants with Oxygen in toxic and low breathability environments.

Worn_Atmo_Suit.desc:
A worn out Atmo Suit.

Suits can be repaired at an Exosuit Forge.

Cool_Vest.name: Cool Vest
Cool_Vest.desc: Protects the wearer from Heat by decreasing insulation

CustomClothing.name: Primo Garb
CustomClothing.desc: Increases Decor in a small area effect around the wearer

Funky_Vest.name: Snazzy Suit
Funky_Vest.desc: Increases Decor in a small area effect around the wearer. Can be upgraded to Primo Garb at the Clothing Refashionator

Jet_Suit.name: Jet Suit
Jet_Suit.desc:
Supplies Duplicants with Oxygen in toxic and low breathability environments.

Allows Duplicant flight.

Worn_Jet_Suit.name: Worn Jet Suit
Worn_Jet_Suit.desc:
A worn out Jet Suit.

Suits can be repaired at an Exosuit Forge.

SleepClinicPajamas.desc:
A soft, fleecy ticket to dreamland.

Helps Duplicants fall asleep by reducing Stamina.

Enables the wearer to dream and produce Dream Journals.
